Results: 28.6% of the 28 respondents replied “slightly” to improved hearing and 46% claimed they have better hearing due to their vision impairment
Evaluation: The use of sound to indicate movement on the rock climbing wall is further evaluated to be successful as 76% of the participants replied yes or slightly to their hearing improving, having positive indications that the method of sound to indicate the movement of the climber is a clear and prominent indicative tool.
